title: BBC Local Live: Channel Islands on Thursday 5 October 2017 - BBC News
summary: abuse allegations against sir edward heath in jersey and guernsey .
`` irreversible change '' warning as guernsey development tribunal ends .
sea lettuce worries addressed at jersey conference .
plans for new , affordable homes in st ouen to be considered .

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: our coverage across the channel islands has finished for the day .
we 'll be back on friday from 08:00 with the latest news , weather , travel and sport .
do n't forget bbc channel islands news on bbc one at 18:30 and 22:30 .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: weather update : windy and clear before a patchy friday
text: spells of sunshine and windy conditions will persist into the evening , with it feeling rather cool too .
the cloud will melt away tonight allowing lengthy clear spells overnight .
friday will see a cold but sunny start , with just some patchy cloud around during the day .
maximum temperature : 15c ( 59f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: water reserves slightly down despite wet september
text: rainfall in guernsey during last month was 70 % higher than the average for the month over the past 10 years .
guernsey water 's latest water supply shows 91.8mm of rain fell in september .
however , it added that the substantial rainfall in the month did n't reflect the amount of water collected in its reservoirs , with overall reserves decreasing by 0.9 % .
the amount of water used by customers was 368 megalitres , 44 less than august .
the company said total water storage capacity was at 89 % .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: population to be a core election issue
text: tackling the island 's growing population will be one of the core to that dominates discussions during next year 's election campaign , according to a jep survey of sitting states members .
author: Jersey Evening Post

documents.title: states defends employment services for older people
text: the states of guernsey has robustly defended employment services available for older people following recent criticism .

a states spokesperson said a range of support was available for older people trying to find work - such as training opportunities and placement programmes - after critics claimed there was little such help .
the states said unemployment in the 60 to 64-year-old group was lower than the unemployment rate for all other islanders .

it admitted there were certain challenges facing older people trying to stay in employment , such as managing health conditions , maintaining skills and , in some cases , facing misconceptions from work colleagues .
the employment and social security committee is working on a longer working lives project , which is due to be debated by the assembly this december .

documents.title: police tribute to 'dear friend and colleague ' ian wright
text: guernsey police have formed a guard of honour at the funeral of det con ian wright , who died earlier this month .
during his career , he received six commendations and 17 acknowledgements .
he also received the richard mauger award for outstanding achievement in 2006 for his bravery in dealing with an aggressive and threatening male who was armed with several knives , the force said .
his police number , 139 , has officially been retired .
a final salute of respect for much-loved guernsey police officer .
# rip detective constable ian wright .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: chief minister denies handing theresa may a p45
text: chief minister ian gorst has jokingly denied that he was the man who handed over a fake p45 resignation letter to prime minister theresa may during the tory party conference , after islanders spotted similarities between the senator and the prankster .
author: Jersey Evening Post

documents.title: jersey butter to go on south korean shelves
text: people in south korea will be able to buy jersey butter , as the island 's dairy expands its business overseas .
very low global milk prices last year led to an increase in demand , which has left supplies low and the price of butter rising significantly .
now countries are looking to other suppliers and jersey dairy has been contacted by companies in turkey and india .
export consultant bob jones said a deal has been struck with a large korean supermarket group .
he said : `` it will be a leading product for them in their dairy category .

`` we 're getting increased interest in japan for our butter , and we are actually planning on going to the middle east in november , where we already started with supplies of milk ; and there 's a large retail group there who i think would be interested in butter . ''
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: social security officials propose 'affordable ' prescription charge rise
text: despite a recommendation from the previous states to raise the prescription charge to £ 4.40 , it would increase by just 2.6 % , to £ 3.90 , under the latest proposals .
author: Guernsey Press

documents.title: sea lettuce trial under way
text: a trial is already under way in jersey to make use of the large amount of sea lettuce that accumulates on island beaches .
officials are attending a conference in jersey today , with experts from as far away as new zealand coming to discuss how the island might cope with the blight .
the states has spent thousands of pounds trying to remove and reduce the algae over the years .
martin gautier , from the infrastructure department , said a new trial was currently under way .
the aim was to `` spread in on to farmland that is n't going to be used for a long time as a long-term fertilizer substitute , '' he said .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: further wind warning issued
text: strong north to northwesterly winds are continuing across the islands .
the wind warning by jersey met advises caution in any wind sensitive activities and to secure loose objects .
wind warning № 11/10 , issued at 14:50 utc , 05/10/2017 .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: lifeboat volunteers to meet with manager
text: a meeting will take place in jersey later between an rnli director responsible for volunteer lifeboat crews and st helier rnli volunteers and staff .

the rnli previously said it was `` committed '' to working with remaining volunteers at the st helier lifeboat station after a volunteer crew member resigned earlier this week , saying he had `` lost all respect '' for the organisation .

dr david howell wrote to the local crew , criticising how complaints within the organisation were being handled and to highlight the amount of money the charity had lost as result of the dismissal and reinstatement of the coxswain earlier this year .
today 's visit by director of community lifesaving and fundraising leesa harwood was a regular crew visit , the rnli said .
`` she is in jersey to speak to just a few of our volunteers , '' it added .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: minimum wage proposal does not go far enough , says deputy
text: proposals to increase the minimum wage by 4.5 per cent do not go far enough , and £ 7.50 an hour will `` not provide low-paid workers with sufficient funds to live on , '' a backbench deputy has said .
author: Jersey Evening Post

documents.title: guernsey fund industry growth highlighted
text: the chief executive of guernsey finance says a willingness to embrace new technologies and ideas is the main reason the island 's fund industry is growing .
guernsey has just been named `` best centre for fund administration '' at the 2017 fund services awards .
dominic wheatley said the volume of incoming and repeat business in the sector showed confidence in guernsey .
`` guernsey 's funds industry is going from strength to strength and that 's thanks to government , industry , the regulator and guernsey finance .
`` the island embraces new technologies and ideas and we anticipate further success for our funds sector in the future , '' he said .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: job losses at channel islands ' bank
text: the royal bank of canada has confirmed jobs are going from its british isles wealth management business , which is based in jersey , guernsey , london and edinburgh .
the company has n't said how many jobs will be lost in the channel islands , but that changes to the business will mean a `` small number , around 3 % '' of employees would be leaving , it said .
rbc wealth management employs 1,200 people in the british isles and opened its first channel islands office in jersey in 1962 .
communications manager fiona mclean said the business was focusing `` on the capabilities that we need now and in the future to meet our clients ' evolving needs '' .
she said : `` as a result , we have made some difficult decisions and a small number of people are leaving our british isles wealth management business .
we will provide support and assistance to those affected by these changes . ''
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: guernsey fc go down to leaders lewes
text: guernsey fc 's recent upturn in form came to an end when they were beaten 3-0 by isthmian league division one south leaders lewes at footes lane .
billy medlock gave the visitors the lead after 15 minutes and doubled the tally after half-an-hour before bouwa bosma 's strike made it 3-0 shortly before the half-time break .
`` i think we made a good side look even better , '' manager tony vance said .
`` in the first half , apart from the first 15 minutes , they blitzed us . ''
the loss ended a two-game winning streak for the green lions and saw them drop to 20th place in the table .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: call for tougher firework laws after horse is hurt
text: a horse owner is calling for stricter laws governing private firework displays after her horse injured himself in his stable while panicking because of a nearby display .
author: Jersey Evening Post

documents.title: police appeal after motorbike moved
text: guernsey police are appealing for information after a motorbike was taken from a parking bay in st peter port .
the blue and black bmw f800 gt motorcycle is believed to have been pushed from les canichers into park street and abandoned in the middle of the road overnight on monday .
anyone with any information is asked to contact police .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: heath report : jersey police 'dealt with four allegations '
text: states of jersey police have confirmed they dealt with four allegations against the late prime minister , sir edward heath .
along with neighbouring guernsey 's police , jersey was one of 14 forces to have cooperated in an investigation into allegations of child abuse published today by wiltshire police .
the operation received 42 claims in total , seven of which would have seen the former conservative politician interviewed under caution - if he was still alive .
no inference of guilt should be drawn from this fact , police stressed .

det supt stewart gull said : we can confirm that jersey is one of the 14 police areas that featured as part of this investigation and that a total of four allegations were reported to have occurred locally .
these allegations were received between 2015 and 2016 and referred to wiltshire police for investigation as part of operation conifer , '' he said .
guernsey 's police force has also confirmed its involvement .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: wind warning in force
text: a strong wind warning is currently in force across the islands .
the advice is to take caution with `` wind sensitive '' activities and secure lose objects .
wind warning № 10/10 , issued at 08:47 utc , 05/10/2017 .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: vehicles submerged in royal terrace deluge
text: at least 300,000 litres of water flooded the royal terrace underground car park , leaving some vehicles submerged underwater .
author: Guernsey Press

documents.title: abuse allegations against sir edward heath in jersey and guernsey
text: two allegations of child abuse against the late prime minister sir edward heath while he was in guernsey and jersey feature in seven claims that would have seen him interviewed under caution .
wiltshire police launched operation conifer two years ago after the conservative politician was accused of historical child sex abuse .
the operation received 42 claims in total .
it was alleged sir edward indecently assaulted , over clothing , an adult male during a chance encounter at a public event in jersey in 1976 .
a uk resident also claimed sir edward indecently assaulted him , at the age of 15 in guernsey in 1967 .
it is alleged the victim was not known to him , and it happened in private , during a chance encounter in a public building .
no inference of guilt should be drawn from the fact that he would have been interviewed , police stressed .
the sir edward heath foundation called the report `` profoundly unsatisfactory '' .
sir edward , who led a tory government in the 1970s , died in 2005 , aged 89 .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: 'my jersey ' consultation ends
text: a consultation on plans for jersey 's future has closed .
the my jersey initiative aims to shape the way the island changes over the next 20 years .

islanders had given their thoughts and opinions on a range of important subjects , including people 's safety , their jobs , health , and the state of the natural environment , assistant director for strategic planning dr ian skinner said .
the initiative also hoped to address the high cost of buying a house in the island , and the growing number of deaths and injuries on the roads , he added .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: hedgehogs will be moved if found during rockface work
text: work to install rockfall netting at le val des terres will be stopped if any hibernating hedgehogs are uncovered , agriculture , countryside and land management services has said .
author: Guernsey Press

documents.title: guernsey allegation in heath report
text: guernsey 's police force has been named in a report into allegations of child abuse against the late prime minister , sir edward heath .
it 's one of fourteen forces within the uk to feature in the investigation by wiltshire police - which released its findings at 11:00 .
the allegation was made by a uk resident in august 2015 and an interview was carried out by thames valley police , the guernsey force said .
the report concluded that one allegation was made which was said to have taken place in guernsey and , if sir edward were alive today , it would have resulted in him being interviewed under caution .
no inference of guilt should be drawn from this fact , police stressed .
sir edward , who led a tory government in the 1970s , died in 2005 , aged 89 .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: les blanches : loss of dairy farming land 'tiny '
text: loss of agricultural land in guernsey is not an excuse to reject building on les blanches site in st martins , according to developers .
if approved , the site would see 26 homes built .
in closing statements at a planning tribunal yesterday , island development limited said it would provide legitimate social housing .
executive director tony grange said the amount of agricultural land lost would be tiny .
`` there is four vergees that have been lost .
four .

`` the dairy farming industry in guernsey uses 8,000 vergees , there are fourteen of fifteen such farmers , each one on average , therefore , must have four-to-five hundred vergees , at least , to use , '' he said .
a decision is expected in november .
author: Simon Fairclough
Guernsey Political Reporter

documents.title: new air-taxi service plans to bring back pet travel
text: the operators of a new air-taxi service have said they will soon start carrying passengers and pets , becoming the first inter-island airline in years to allow animals on planes .
author: Jersey Evening Post

documents.title: telco survey : business satisfaction results
text: channel islands competition regulator cicra 's comparison between island and uk business satisfaction has shown a mixed
fixed internet services have been rated marginally better than in the uk , but landline and mobile services were rated significantly worse .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: fitness centre for ill islanders opens
text: a new healthy lifestyle centre at guernsey 's beau sejour leisure site has officially opened .
the facility caters for people who suffer from various illnesses , including diabetes , ms and cancers .
it will have a `` fit for purpose '' area for health , well-being and rehabilitation sessions to be held , managers said .
bailiff sir richard collas officially opened the centre , which he said will be benefit islanders ' mental and physical wellbeing .
`` the importance of exercise in a safe environment , where you can keep the body moving , keep the muscles going and generally feel better , is something that is very important , '' he said .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: st ouen development 'could help young people '
text: it is hoped a new housing development in st ouen could tempt more young people to stay in the parish and help older people to downsize .

the local deputy and constable have written to parishioners asking if they 'd like to have a scheme similar to those in trinity and st peter , where people share ownership of their homes with the parish .
deputy richard renouf said parishioners were concerned by a lack of affordable housing .
he said : `` there are n't the young starter homes there once were .
some young people have left the island because they could n't afford to live here .
`` all throughout the island we need to do something to keep our young people in the island in affordable accommodation . ''
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: weather : brightening up this afternoon
text: it 's a mostly cloudy start , with some outbreaks of rain possible through the morning .
things are then brightening up with the chance of some sunny spells developing into the afternoon .
it wo n't feel particularly warm in the northwesterly breeze though , with a maximum of 16c ( 61f ) .
author: Alex Osborne
BBC Weather

documents.title: sir edward heath abuse probe report to be published
text: the findings of a national police investigation into allegations of child abuse against the late prime minister , sir edward heath , will be published this morning .
mr heath often came on sailing holidays to jersey , and was investigated as part of operation whistle after allegations were made against him .
sir edward , who led a tory government in the 1970s , died in 2005 , aged 89 .
the bbc understands the investigation has concluded that if sir edward were still alive , there would have been sufficient grounds to question him .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: ill passenger 'recovering ' after flight was diverted
text: guernsey airline aurigny says a passenger who fell ill on a flight from the east midlands on saturday is `` recovering well '' after the flight had to be diverted to southampton .
gary manning , a nurse at the princess elizabeth hospital , provided support to the crew and passenger .
aurigny ceo mark darby said the crew acted `` very quickly and decisively '' to deal with a serious medical emergency .
`` i 'd also like to thank mr manning for providing invaluable support in the cabin .
i 've been told it was an incredible response from everyone involved , '' he said .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: football : jersey 1-1 draw 'shows island ready for uefa '
text: jersey manager martin cassidy says last night 's 1-1 draw with northern ireland under 21s shows that the island is capable of playing internationals .
last week , the court of arbitration for sport ruled that uefa 's congress must vote on jersey 's application to become an international football nation .
`` hopefully this helps our bid , '' cassidy told bbc radio jersey .
`` it shows that we are not a million miles away from what the smaller nations would be expected to be . ''
jersey 's side , which had an average age of 23 , went behind after just three minutes when mark sykes calmly slotted in the opener for the visitors .
but jersey were soon level when calvin weir got the slightest of touches on his brother michael weir 's corner .
the northern irish were using the game as part of their preparation for next week 's euro under-21 qualifying clash with estonia .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: business 'less satisfied ' with telco services than in uk
text: channel islands businesses are significantly less satisfied with landline and mobile services than their uk counterparts , according to survey findings released by the channel islands competition regulator , cicra .
more than 230 businesses were surveyed in jersey and guernsey .
some 70 % of guernsey and 67 % of jersey businesses were satisfied with their landline services , compared to the uk average of 83 % .
satisfaction was significantly lower than the uk ( 90 % ) when it came to businesses rating mobile services , with 69 % in jersey satisfied with guernsey at 73 % .
telecoms businesses performed well in fixed internet services , with providers sure and jt scoring an average of 69 % in guernsey and 70 % in jersey , just over the 68 % uk average .
author: Edward Rowe
Broadcast Journalist, BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: weed worries addressed at conference
text: sea lettuce experts are in jersey for a two-day conference to discuss how the island might cope with it .
speakers from other places affected by the green seaweed are expected to share ideas on how it might be used as a resource .
one speaker from new zealand will be describing how the country has managed sea lettuce clean-ups in tauranga harbour .
the green algae has blighted jersey 's coastline for years and the states has spent thousands of pounds trying to remove and reduce it .
various experiments , including digging furrows and dumping it at sea , have failed to solve the problem .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: 'irreversible change ' warning as development tribunal ends
text: a st martins resident opposed to the development of les blanches site says the loss of agricultural land will affect future generations and the island 's heritage .
closing statements were heard yesterday at a two-day planning tribunal .
developers made the case for building 26 homes , saying they would provide legitimate social housing , meet planning requirements and would n't affect the road network of the area .
but st martins resident and campaigner against the development yvonne hodder said any loss of farming land would equate to diminished island heritage .
`` this is n't a temporary development .
this is a large development that is irreversible . ''
`` once the land is gone , it 's gone .
it can never go back to being agricultural land , '' she said .
a decision on whether the states was right to block plans to build the homes in st martins is expected in november .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: local live across the channel islands
text: good morning and welcome to bbc local live across the channel islands .
stay with us for all the latest news , weather , travel and sport for the day .
if you want to get in touch , please email us .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online
